titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that Dorothy I. Height should be recognized for her achievements as a civil rights leader, dedicated activist working to fight racial and social prejudice, and for her lifetime commitment to improving the opportunities available to the most vulnerable in society.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 2/27/2003--Introduced. Expresses the sense of Congress that Dorothy I. Height should be recognized for her lifelong work to secure equality and human rights for people around the world and for her leadership in creating opportunities for the Nation's youth.
